rope_jumping_agreement.title: MEDICAL CONTRAINDICATIONS
rope_jumping_agreement.subtitle: Most people can jump, but there are diseases that (with whom) you must be careful.

list.1: Musculoskeletal system: spinal injuries in the past, spinal surgery, herniated discs, 3 degrees scoliosis, congenital malformations of the spine.
list.2: The cardiovascular system: congenital and acquired malformations of the heart, pacemaker, rhythm disorders (arrhythmia), arterial hypertension, hypertension stage 2-3, heart failure.
list.3: Respiratory system: asthma of mixed genesis.
list.4: (The) early postoperative period: first 3 months after surgery
list.8: Psychiatric disorders in the acute stage: schizophrenia, MDS, etc.
list.9: The omission of the kidneys of 2-3 degrees.
list.12: Coming to the event in a state of alcoholic, drug intoxication
list.14: Do not listen to / ignore the guidance of instructors

rope_jumping_agreement.lower_title: Remember, that organizers can't visually assess your physical and psychological health, you're responsible for your jump!
